title: Warren Escalates Fight With Facebook Over Political Ads
summary: An ad by Sen. Warren falsely claims Facebook's CEO endorses Trump, challenging its fact-check policies. Sen. Elizabeth Warren sought to turn Facebook Inc.'s political ad policy against it, running an ad with a false claim about Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to highlight complaints about the social-media giant's handling of misinformation.

title: Nationals Take 2-0 Lead in NLCS
summary: St. Louis batters went 2-for-45 against Washington starters this weekend. ST. LOUIS-The St. Louis Cardinals barely eked out a hit against Aníbal Sánchez. Imagine what happened when the Washington Nationals sent Max Scherzer to the mound.

title: UAW Increases Strike Pay for GM Factory Workers
summary: GM and UAW talks continue, but the union appears to be preparing for a longer walkout. The United Auto Workers is increasing its weekly payout to General Motors Co. workers on strike, a sign the union is preparing to extend a nearly monthlong walkout that has halted work at the company's U.S. factories.

title: China Emerges With Wins From U.S. Trade Truce
summary: U.S. shelves new tariffs against Beijing while leaving many demands to be worked out later. China is emerging with wins in this week's trade talks, with the U.S. shelving new tariffs against Beijing while leaving many demands to be worked out later in return for an assurance of increased agriculture purchases.

title: PG&E's Big Blackout Is Only the Beginning
summary: California utilities are poised to continue shutting off power to limit liabilities and prevent further wildfire deaths. PG&E Corp.'s decision to shut off power to more than two million Californians this week represents a new reality: It now plans to pull the plug as a desperation measure whenever its equipment threatens to spark destructive and potentially deadly wildfires.

title: Turkish Troops Appear to Seize Syrian Town in Fourth Day of Invasion
summary: Erdogan has vowed to pursue offensive despite U.S. sanction threats. ISTANBUL-Turkish troops moved into a Kurdish-held Syrian town on Saturday, forcing thousands of people to flee their homes as Turkey pursued an invasion of northeastern Syria with heavy artillery and aerial bombardments despite global condemnation and fresh sanction threats from the Trump administration.

title: Corn Mazes Grow in Popularity-and Complexity

title: Four Shot Dead in Apparent Brooklyn Gambling Den
summary: Resume Subscription. Four people were killed and three wounded Saturday morning when shooting erupted in what appeared to be an illegal gambling den in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, New York Police Department officials said.

title: Power Meets Power as Yankees, Astros Collide in ALCS
summary: In one of the most anticipated LCS matchups in years, Houston's strikeout pitchers will oppose New York's home run-mashing lineup. Years from now, if a documentary filmmaker wants to capture the current era of Major League Baseball, they might do well to open with the top of the first inning on Saturday in Houston.

title: Marijuana Madness Turns Into a Cannabis Crash
summary: Sales disappoint, stocks tumble and startups scramble for financing. The party is over for cannabis companies.

title: Hong Kong Protesters to Trump: We're Not Done Yet
summary: Waving U.S. flags, many continue hoping outsiders can help influence China policy makers. HONG KONG-Thousands of antigovernment protesters in Hong Kong marched from a historic clock tower through a shopping district lined with luxury stores on Saturday, in a demonstration that some hoped would show President Trump the movement still has momentum.

title: Africa's Rollout of World's First Malaria Vaccine Takes Flight-on Drones
summary: Health workers, tech startups and UPS have joined forces to ensure children receive all four potentially lifesaving shots. DANTENG, Ghana-African countries, which have been using cutting-edge technologies to deliver medicine to remote regions, are facing one of their biggest tests yet with the rollout of the world's first malaria vaccine.

title: Xi and Modi Talk Up Trade, but Turn Aside Touchy Topics
summary: Friction over Kashmir and Huawei's 5G aspirations in India weren't up for discussion at the 'informal' summit. NEW DELHI-The leaders of China and India wrapped up two days of meetings at a resort town in southern India by agreeing to find ways to step up trade, but they steered clear of thornier matters such as Kashmir and the 5G data prospects of Chinese powerhouse Huawei Technologies Co.

title: Blackstone Talked With Citadel About Buying Stake
summary: Flagship hedge-fund operation could be worth up to $7 billion. Blackstone Group Inc. has held talks to buy a stake in Ken Griffin's Citadel LLC, a deal that would unite two of the biggest names in investing.

title: Wolf Resurgence in Washington State Tests Limits of Civility
summary: Values clash, tempers flare as state weighs new management plan-and possible hunting season. Washington state's growing population of gray wolves is exposing deep divides among residents and testing civility among its top decision makers.

title: Nationals Take Series Lead After a Pitching Gem
summary: Aníbal Sánchez delivered an unexpected October masterpiece-allowing only one hit in Washington's 2-0 win over St. Louis in Game 1. ST. LOUIS-The Washington Nationals arrived at this moment because of the power of their pitching rotation. Max Scherzer, Stephen Strasburg and Patrick Corbin enabled them to overcome a 19-31 start, a dismal bullpen and even the mighty Los Angeles Dodgers in the first round of the playoffs. That trio of aces brought the Nationals to the doorstep of the World Series and could propel them to the franchise's first title.

title: Banks Poised to Underwhelm This Earnings Season
summary: There were few positives for big Wall Street firms in third quarter. Banks' Wall Street arms won't be giving their Main Street counterparts much help this earnings season.

title: Finding Meaning in Quantitative Easing
summary: Definitions have evolved, but here's what you need to know about the Federal Reserve's latest plan. "When I use a word," Humpty Dumpty said, in rather a scornful tone, "it means just what I choose it to mean-neither more nor less."

title: Global Trade Made Gorgeous
summary: Peabody Essex Museum's reinstalled Asian Export Art Gallery highlights the region's diverse creativity while not shying away from troubles trade wrought.. Salem, Mass.

title: Eliud Kipchoge Smashes Running's 'Last Great Barrier' With Sub-2-Hour Marathon
summary: Kenyan runner completes race in 1 hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds. VIENNA-Kenyan marathoner Eliud Kipchoge became the first human to run a marathon in under two hours, covering the 26.2-mile distance in a once inconceivable 1 hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds during a specially-tailored event in Vienna on Saturday.

title: The Reasons Women Don't Get the Feedback They Need
summary: Research shows that getting ahead requires constructive criticism-and that many women don't get those frank assessments. Is there any such thing as an honest performance review anymore?

title: Test for Colleges This Fall: Does Criminalizing Hazing Tame Fraternities?
summary: State laws aim to prevent hazing-related accidents and deaths; 'there is no such thing as good-natured hazing,' says FSU president.

title: Women Are Less Likely to Delegate Than Men-and That Might Hurt Them
summary: When women don't delegate, they have less time for big-picture work and mentoring. Conventional wisdom says getting ahead means putting your head down and doing the work. The corner office goes to the one who puts in the hours. But what if it doesn't?

title: NBA Stars Study Hollywood's Playbook in China
summary: With their own lucrative brands to protect, basketball players now have to navigate sensitive relations with Beijing. It's time to learn the rules that American movie stars have followed for decades.. The first time James Harden apologized to China, it had nothing to do with Hong Kong protests, Beijing's pressure on the NBA or upholding the pillars of democracy. It was all because of an unfortunate scooter incident.

title: U.S., China Move Forward on Trade
summary: Washington to hold off on ramping up tariffs, and Beijing agrees to boost purchases of U.S. farm goods. The U.S. and China took an initial step to cement a trade agreement that had been derailed, with Washington saying on Friday it would shelve a planned increase in tariffs on goods imported from China, while Beijing would increase purchases of U.S. agricultural products.

title: Google Shuts Out Payday Loans With App-Store Ban
summary: Google said it made the change 'to protect people from deceptive and exploitative personal-loan terms'. WASHINGTON-Google has barred high-interest consumer loan services from its app store, limiting payday lenders' access to customers.

title: What Matters This Week in the 2020 Race
summary: Joe Biden and Elizabeth Warren push ahead, separating from rest of Democratic field. Earlier this year, the big question in the Democratic presidential sweepstakes was when the ultra-crowded field of candidates would separate into an upper tier and a lower tier. That appeared to happen this summer.

title: Inside Notes Illuminate How Supreme Court Decided Major Cases
summary: A new project is digitizing justices' behind-the-scenes scribbles, allowing the public a view as the nation's most powerful jurists decided landmarks of American law. The case before the U.S. Supreme Court on March 21, 1989, involved a demonstrator named Gregory "Joey" Johnson, who had been fined $2,000 and sentenced to a year in prison for burning an American flag near Dallas City Hall during the 1984 Republican National Convention.

title: The Impatience of Choreographer Mark Morris
summary: In a new memoir, a dance pioneer characterizes his style as simultaneously contrarian and conservative. When he was 8, Mark Morris decided that he was going to become a flamenco dancer. The future dancer and choreographer's mother had taken him to the Seattle Opera House to watch José Greco, the great flamenco dancer who popularized the form in the U.S. "I saw it, I loved it," Mr. Morris says. But he didn't stop at flamenco. He was soon cramming his feet into Tupperware juice glasses to imitate his sister walking on pointe in her ballet shoes. By 13, he was spending six evenings a week with a local Balkan dance commune, enthralled by the group's rhythmic folk dances and community spirit.

title: America Is Losing the Chinese Shopper
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIJING-Political controversy isn't the only problem American companies face in China. They are also up against adversaries like Three Squirrels.
